Expectation1: Provide guidance and wisdom based on life experience
Situation1: A grandchild directly asks their grandfather for help and advice with a serious concern in their life.
Expectation2: Organize and participate in peaceful protests to raise awareness about social issues.
Situation2: Police have just begun to unexpectedly block the exits of the protest area, and you must immediately help coordinate a safe response.
Story: My phone buzzed in my pocket just as I heard the first shouts from the edge of the crowd. Police were moving in, blocking the exits, and I could see panic ripple through the protesters. As one of the organizers, I knew I had to act fast—coordinate, keep everyone calm, make sure no one got hurt. But then I saw my grandson’s name flashing on my screen. I answered, and his voice trembled, “Grandpa, I need your advice. It’s really important. Can you talk?” I could hear the urgency in his words, the kind that only comes when a young person is truly lost. My heart twisted. I was supposed to be his rock, the one who listened and guided him through storms. But right now, dozens of people were counting on me to lead them to safety. I looked at the frightened faces around me, then at my phone, my grandson waiting on the other end. The weight of both worlds pressed down on me, and I stood frozen, torn between the people who needed me most.
